text.__SUMMARY__: Solanum ashbyae is a species of plant in the nightshade family that is endemic to Western Australia. The specific epithet ashbyae honours botanical illustrator and plant collector Alison Ashby.
text.Description: Its growth form is that of an erect shrub, 0.5–2.5 m in height. It produces blue to purple flowers from April to August.
text.Distribution and habitat: It occurs on red sand or clay soils on rock outcrops and stony rises in the Gascoyne, Murchison, Pilbara and Yalgoo IBRA bioregions.
text.References: "Solanum ashbyae Symon". Atlas of Living Australia.
